world.name: Solar System Explorer
world.subject: astronomy
world.description: Explore our solar system from Mercury to Neptune
world.prompt: Flying through outer space with stars and nebulae in the background, approaching planets in our solar system

positions.start: Floating in space, Sun visible in the distance
positions.forward: Approaching Mercury, the closest planet to the Sun
positions.forward_forward: Flying past Mercury, Venus coming into view
positions.forward_right: Viewing the outer planets in the distance
positions.right: Mars visible in the distance with its red surface
positions.turn_left: Rotating to view different star clusters
positions.turn_right: Turning to see Jupiter and its moons
positions.backward: Moving back toward the outer solar system

educationalPoints: Mercury is the smallest planet and closest to the Sun
Venus is the hottest planet due to its thick atmosphere
Earth is the only planet known to have liquid water on its surface
Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system - Olympus Mons
suggestedQuestions: Why is Mercury not the hottest planet?
How big is Jupiter compared to Earth?
